summary: Dominica, officially the Commonwealth of Dominica, is an island country in the Caribbean Sea. It's part of the Windward Islands and is known as the "Nature Island of the Caribbean" due to its lush, mountainous rainforests and unique wildlife. The island was first settled by the Arawak and later by the Kalinago people. Christopher Columbus spotted it in 1493, and it was later colonized by the French and then the British. Dominica gained independence in 1978. It's famous for its natural wonders like Boiling Lake, the world's second-largest hot spring. The Sisserou parrot, Dominica's national bird, is one of the island's rare species.
title: Dominica
